original: > The Segments section allows you to view a comprehensive list of your existing segments, create new segments, and edit existing segments. You can refine the list of segments by selecting a variety of filters and columns so only the most relevant information to you is displayed.
replacement: > The Segments section allows you to view a comprehensive list of your existing segments, create new segments, and edit existing segments. You can refine the list of segments by selecting a variety of filters and columns so only the most relevant information to you are displayed.

original: You is able to query against the most recent two years of data for each event in the corresponding `USERS_*_SHARED` view. Additionally, each event will have a `USERS_*_SHARED_ALL` view which can be queried against to return both anonymized and non-anonymized data.
replacement: You are able to query against the most recent two years of data for each event in the corresponding `USERS_*_SHARED` view. Additionally, each event will have a `USERS_*_SHARED_ALL` view which can be queried against to return both anonymized and non-anonymized data.

original: 2. Provide a name and notification email in the workflow modal. Click the **Create** button. On creation, you is taken to the Workflow Builder. Your Braze workflow is seeded with API calls and actions that can be used to process deletion requests.

original: You is redirected to the Fivetran connector page. On this page, fill out the given fields. Next, click **Continue** > **Save & Test** to complete the Fivetran connector.
replacement: You are redirected to the Fivetran connector page. On this page, fill out the given fields. Next, click **Continue** > **Save & Test** to complete the Fivetran connector.

original: Select **Another AWS Account** and provide the Fivetran account ID `834469178297`. Make sure to check the **Require external ID** checkbox. Here, you provides the external ID found in step 1.
replacement: Select **Another AWS Account** and provide the Fivetran account ID `834469178297`. Make sure to check the **Require external ID** checkbox. Here, you provide the external ID found in step 1.

original: - Custom attributes: Specify here the new fields you sends to Braze, their format (string, integer, float), and tick the **Required for syncs** if you want one of them to be mandatory for a sync.
replacement: - Custom attributes: Specify here the new fields you send to Braze, their format (string, integer, float), and tick the **Required for syncs** if you want one of them to be mandatory for a sync.

original: Next, select **Braze** as the destination and which entity you sends data to.
replacement: Next, select **Braze** as the destination and which entity you send data to.

original: 6. Lastly, select **Save / Publish** found at the top of the page. If you do not publish your source, you is unable to find it when configuring your Braze connector.
replacement: 6. Lastly, select **Save / Publish** found at the top of the page. If you do not publish your source, you are unable to find it when configuring your Braze connector.

original: Segment **does not** limit the number of data elements clients send to them. Segment allows you to send all or decide which events you sends to Braze. Rather than sending all of your events using Segment, we suggest you review use cases with your marketing and editorial teams to determine which events you sends to Braze to avoid data overages.
replacement: Segment **does not** limit the number of data elements clients send to them. Segment allows you to send all or decide which events you send to Braze. Rather than sending all of your events using Segment, we suggest you review use cases with your marketing and editorial teams to determine which events you send to Braze to avoid data overages.

original: Use Audiences to send user properties and computations to Braze as custom attributes. You is able to sync user properties or computed properties for users who have been active in the last 90 days.
replacement: Use Audiences to send user properties and computations to Braze as custom attributes. You are able to sync user properties or computed properties for users who have been active in the last 90 days.

original: If you intend to create more than one Currents connector to send to your S3 bucket, you is able to use the same credentials, but must specify a different folder path for each. These can be created in the same workspace, or split and created within multiple workspaces. You also have the option of creating a single policy for each integration, or create one policy that covers both integrations.
replacement: If you intend to create more than one Currents connector to send to your S3 bucket, you are able to use the same credentials, but must specify a different folder path for each. These can be created in the same workspace, or split and created within multiple workspaces. You also have the option of creating a single policy for each integration, or create one policy that covers both integrations.

original: Next, you is creating your encryption signature using a [SHA1 HMAC](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HMAC) hash of the project URL and the payload.
replacement: Next, you are creating your encryption signature using a [SHA1 HMAC](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HMAC) hash of the project URL and the payload.

original: - SMS messages at Braze are charged per message segment. Understanding what defines a segment and how these messages is split is key in understanding how you is billed for messages. replacement: - SMS messages at Braze are charged per message segment. Understanding what defines a segment and how these messages is split is key in understanding how you are billed for messages. See more information in our [documentation]({{site.baseurl}}/user_guide/message_building_by_channel/sms_mms_rcs/segments/).

original: If you plan to integrate with a custom external ID (for either the [standard integration]({{site.baseurl}}/partners/ecommerce/shopify/shopify_standard_integration/#step-4-configure-how-you-manage-users) or the [custom integration]({{site.baseurl}}/partners/ecommerce/shopify/shopify_custom_integration/#step-6-configure-how-you-manage-users-optional)), you is required to add your custom external ID as a Shopify customer metafield to all existing Shopify customer profiles and then perform the [historical backfill]({{site.baseurl}}/partners/ecommerce/shopify/shopify_data_features/#historical-backfill).
replacement: If you plan to integrate with a custom external ID (for either the [standard integration]({{site.baseurl}}/partners/ecommerce/shopify/shopify_standard_integration/#step-4-configure-how-you-manage-users) or the [custom integration]({{site.baseurl}}/partners/ecommerce/shopify/shopify_custom_integration/#step-6-configure-how-you-manage-users-optional)), you are required to add your custom external ID as a Shopify customer metafield to all existing Shopify customer profiles and then perform the [historical backfill]({{site.baseurl}}/partners/ecommerce/shopify/shopify_data_features/#historical-backfill).

original: If you plan to integrate with a custom external ID (for either the [standard integration]({{site.baseurl}}/partners/ecommerce/shopify/shopify_standard_integration/#step-4-configure-how-you-manage-users) or the [custom integration]({{site.baseurl}}/partners/ecommerce/shopify/shopify_custom_integration/#step-6-configure-how-you-manage-users-optional)), you is required to add your custom external ID as a Shopify customer metafield to all existing Shopify customer profiles and then perform the historical backfill.

original: You receives a dashboard notification, and your status will display as “In Progress” to indicate the initial sync is starting. Note that the time it takes for the sync to finish will depend on how many products and variants Braze will need to sync over from Shopify. During this time, you can leave this page and wait for a dashboard notification or email to notify you when this is complete.
replacement: You receive a dashboard notification, and your status will display as “In Progress” to indicate the initial sync is starting. Note that the time it takes for the sync to finish will depend on how many products and variants Braze will need to sync over from Shopify. During this time, you can leave this page and wait for a dashboard notification or email to notify you when this is complete.

original: You receives a dashboard notification and an email after the sync is successful. The Shopify partner page will also update the status under Shopify catalogs to “Syncing". You can view your products by clicking the catalog name on the Shopify partner page.
replacement: You receive a dashboard notification and an email after the sync is successful. The Shopify partner page will also update the status under Shopify catalogs to “Syncing". You can view your products by clicking the catalog name on the Shopify partner page.

original: Any criteria you'd typically use to trigger a message (push, email, SMS, or webhook) in a Braze Canvas based on your user data can now be used to trigger an ad to that user in Facebook using custom audiences. original:
4. After Braze is linked to your Facebook account, select which ad accounts you would like to sync within your Braze workspace.

4. After Braze is linked to your Facebook account, select which ad accounts you would like to sync within your Braze workspace.

3. If you haven't already activated Facebook within Braze, you are prompted to go to the Facebook Technology Partners page in the dashboard. There are three possible user fields you can export:

original:
Use the following webhook URL. You receives your campaign_slug from SEEN to call the correct endpoint.

https://api.seen.io/v1/campaigns/{campaign_slug}/receivers/
replacement:
Use the following webhook URL. You receive your campaign_slug from SEEN to call the correct endpoint.

original:

- Authorization: Token {token}
- Content-Type: application/json

You receives your Authentication Token from SEEN.
replacement:
Use the following information to fill out your request headers:
- Authorization: Token {token}
- Content-Type: application/json

You receive your Authentication Token from SEEN.

original: You'll need Jacquard to set up a dedicated Amazon S3 bucket to receive your click tracking events from Braze. Reach out to your Jacquard customer success manager to start this process. When the bucket is created, you is provided unique credentials to create your Current.
